H0.text: Following that year's April Budget, Alderman Sir Cuthbert Ackroyd, who later became Lord Mayor of London, bought the first what on 1 November 1956. Premium Bond

H1.text: Following that year's April Budget, Alderman Sir Cuthbert Ackroyd, who later became Lord Mayor of London, bought the first what on 1 November 1956. Government Security

H2.text: Following that year's April Budget, Alderman Sir Cuthbert Ackroyd, who later became Lord Mayor of London, bought the first what on 1 November 1956. National Savings Certificate

H3.text: Following that year's April Budget, Alderman Sir Cuthbert Ackroyd, who later became Lord Mayor of London, bought the first what on 1 November 1956. ERNIE

A4.text: On 1 November 1956, Alderman Sir Cuthbert Ackroyd bought the first bond from the Postmaster General, Dr Charles Hill, for Â£1.

A5.text: Premium Bonds were introduced by Harold Macmillan, as Chancellor of the Exchequer, in his Budget of 17 April 1956, to control inflation and encourage people to save.
